WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine looking at a narwhal from the front. No mouth. Now look at it from the right. Mouth!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: How did we know to look from the right, though? Because of the youths (ゆう). Youths think in ways that older people usually don't. That's why they can see the swirls on cereal, hear the music behind noise, and of course, look at things from the right side.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
Imagine a bunch of youths walking in a group and looking at everything from the right. You remember when you were a youth and you used to look at everything from one side too.
Note: All the ゆう readings will use the word "youths" for the reading mnemonic. You can think of these "youths" as a group of younger people who cause a lot of the problems in this world, just like how people treat Millennials nowadays.

origin_of_ch_char_book: There are some mysterious commonalities in cultures from different parts of the world. In many cultures, including East and West, “right hand” came to mean positive while the “left hand” came to mean something negative. In China, when one says “you are thinking Left”, it refers to wrong thinking. Right hand (右, you, right) used to mean “help with god’s hands”. Left hand (左, zuo, left) also used to mean “help of god”. Both symbols used to mean “sacred help from god” but now the meaning has changed to “right” and “left”. The respect to the right is reflected in the difference of these two symbols. (口, kou, mouse) in the character of the right means ‘order’, and (工, gong, worker; industry). In the character meaning ‘left,’ it means just a ‘tool (ruler)’ or ‘support’. (力, li, power) means the power of the right hand. And if a field is added on this character (男, nan, man), it means a man who cultivates farmland.
humanum_full_description_en: Bronze inscriptions indicate location words, opposite to the left. Du Hu Talisman: "The Talisman of the Armed Soldier, the right is the king, the left is the Du." Just as the left can be interpreted as " zuo ", the right can also be interpreted as the auxiliary " you ". This is the so-called "left auxiliary right bi" in the idiom. Teacher Xungui: "Bao (Auxiliary) You (You) Xian Wang". "Said the text": ".. And from the mouth to help also from" see " left ", " turn ", " Woo ."
humanum_short_description_en: " Right at the beginning the text as" the " and ", like the shape of the right hand, Jin added from the " mouth " to " the right ."
humanum_full_description: 金文表示方位詞，與左相對。杜虎符：「甲兵之符，右在王，左在杜。」一如左可解作「佐」，右亦可解輔助的「佑」，此即來成語中所謂「左輔右弼」。師詢簋：「尃(輔)右(佑)先王」。《說文》：「助也。从口从又。」參見「左」、「又」、「佑」。
humanum_short_description: 「右」的初文作「又」，象右手之形，金文加從「口」成「右」。

右字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yòu］
［《廣韻》于救切，去宥，云。］
［《廣韻》云久切，上有，云。］
(1)助，帮助。后多作“佑”。
(2)保祐。后多作“祐”。
(3)亲近；袒护。
(4)右手。
(5)右手一边的方位，与“左”相对。
(6)西边。取面向南，则右为西。
(7)面北背南则以东为右。
(8)往右。
(9)车右。亦名骖乘。古制一车乘三人，尊者居左，御车人居中，骖乘居右，以有勇力的人担任。
(10)指右军。
(11)古代崇右，故以右为上，为贵，为高。
(12)谓胜过；超过。
(13)尊崇；崇尚。
(14)权贵。
(15)迂曲。
(16)指政治上、思想上属于保守的或反动的。
(17)通“侑”。劝酒；劝食。
(18)姓。

Впоследствии бронзовый текст был добавлен с «ロ» под правой рукой, чтобы отделить его от «ты, ты, уу, рука» и так далее.
«Ты» - это «шоу», связанное с богами, и джиба добавлена ​​к «правому».
Указывает на Божье благословение.
Цзя, Цзинь и Чжуань записываются как «込, Кэ и родовой дом» соответственно.
Цю Шу (Хань «Остатки Цзыю», «Стела храма Хуашань») заменил дуговые штрихи письменности печати прямыми штрихами и добавил лижэнь, написав «Вправо» и «Монах».

Radicals: ナ, 口  (narwhal, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
Narwhal mouths are on the right side of their head. In fact, some people didn't think they had mouths at all because they weren't looking from the right. Rookie mistake.
Imagine looking at a narwhal from the front. No mouth. Now look at it from the right. Mouth!
Reading Mnemonic
How did we know to look from the right, though? Because of the youths (ゆう). Youths think in ways that older people usually don't. That's why they can see the swirls on cereal, hear the music behind noise, and of course, look at things from the right side.
Imagine a bunch of youths walking in a group and looking at everything from the right. You remember when you were a youth and you used to look at everything from one side too.
Note: All the ゆう readings will use the word "youths" for the reading mnemonic. You can think of these "youths" as a group of younger people who cause a lot of the problems in this world, just like how people treat Millennials nowadays.
